children.name: topic
children.text2:
Name of the topic to send the message to. A topic stores messages of the same
                type. For example, a topic named Payments might store messages about recent
                payments.

children.name: Example
children.text: var message = { 'number': current.number.toString(), 'short_description': current.short_description.toString(), 'caller_id': current.caller_id.getDisplayValue(), 'priority': current.priority.toString(), 'state': current.state.toString() }; var producer = new sn_ih_kafka.Producer(); producer.send('changed_incidents', current.number.toString(), JSON.stringify(message), false);
children.text2:
This  shows how to send changed incident information to the changed_incidents Kafka
        topic.

children.name: key
children.text2:
Name of the key for a specific partition. Topics can be partitioned. Messages
                with the same key are stored in the same partition. For example, payment messages
                with a key of June would all be stored in the same partition of the Payments
                topic.

children.name: isSync
children.text2:
Flag that indicates whether to require the flow to wait for the step to complete before continuing.
Valid values:
  • true: Wait for the step to complete before continuing the associated flow.
  • false: Do not wait for the step to complete before continuing the associated flow.

children.name: send(String topic, String key, String message, Boolean isSync)
children.text: Sends the specified message to the specified Kafka topic.

name: Producer
text: The Producer API provides methods that enable you to push data from a ServiceNow instance to a Kafka topic.
text2:
Note: This API is only supported for customers who have successfully set up Hermes on their instance. Hermes is an infrastructure that enables Customer Kafka to communicate with ServiceNow Kafka.
This API requires the ServiceNow Integration Hub Action Step - Kafka Producer plugin (com.glide.hub.action_step.kafka) and is provided within the sn_ih_kafka namespace.
